page.title: 09The Church in the 1980's
page.content: Norbury Church serves the villages of Roston and Norbury and has currently 55 people on Church Electoral Roll, with an average of 27 regular Sunday worshippers, giving approximately 37 pounds between them each week. In recent years the Great East Window has been altered and restored. The work was completed in 1983 and a Flower Festival to mark the completion of 10 years glass restoration was held in May 1984. The work, carried out by D.King and Sons of Norwich, entailed carefully cleaning the glass with specially discovered techniques and releading it. The span of the Great East Window is about 18ft 6in by 28ft and the glass has been sheeted in a very tough layer of plain glass to protect it from the lichen.
